IMoveToController¶

class Leap::Unity::Interaction::IMoveToController

IMoveToController defines the interface used by the Interaction Engine to move an object from its current position and orientation to a target position and orientation.

The Interaction Engine provides the MoveToControllerKinematic and MoveToControllerVelocity implementations for this controller.

Since
4.1.4

Public Functions

abstract void MoveTo(ReadonlyList < Hand > hands, PhysicsMoveInfo info, Vector3 solvedPosition, Quaternion solvedRotation)

Move the interactable object to or towards the Interaction Engine’s desired position.

If info.shouldTeleport is true, this function must move the object using a teleport-style movement, ie.e by changing the transform.position and transform.rotation, or the RigidBody.position and RigidBody.rotation properties directly. InteractionBehaviour.NotifyTeleport() does not be called in MoveTo().

If info.shouldTeleport is false, this function must move the object using linear and angular forces and velocities.

Since
4.1.4
Parameters
  • hands -

    the list of Leap.Hand objects involved in the interaction.

  • info -

    hints about the move.

  • solvedPosition -

    the target position calculated by the Interaction Engine.

  • solvedRotation -

    the target rotation calculated by the Interaction Engine.

abstract void OnGraspBegin()

Called when the object is grasped by a hand.

You should only change the following properties in this method:

These properties are automatically restored when the object leaves the grabbed state.

Since
4.1.4

abstract void OnGraspEnd()

Called when the object is released by all hands.

Since
4.1.4

abstract void SetGraspedState()

Set the object to a state appropriate for being held in a hand.

Since
4.1.4

struct Leap::Unity::Interaction::PhysicsMoveInfo

Provides hints for moving an interactable object that is being held.

Public Members

float remainingDistanceLastFrame

The distance between the object’s final position and its target position in the previous Unity frame.

bool shouldTeleport

Whether you should move the object by changing its Transform.position property.
